contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Settlement | name = Jindo | native_name = 진도 | native_name_lang = ko | settlement_type = [[List of cities in South Korea|County]] | translit_lang1 = Korean | translit_lang1_type1 = Hangul | translit_lang1_info1 = {{linktext|진|도|군}} | translit_lang1_type2 = Hanja | translit_lang1_info2 = {{linktext|珍|島|郡}} | translit_lang1_type3 = {{nowrap|Revised Romanization}} | translit_lang1_info3 = Jindo-gun | translit_lang1_type4 = {{nowrap|McCune-Reischauer}} | translit_lang1_info4 = Chindo-gun | image_skyline = | imagesize = | image_caption = | image_map = South Jeolla-Jindo.svg | mapsize = | map_caption = Location in South Korea | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{flag|South Korea}} | subdivision_type1 = [[Regions of Korea|Region]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Honam]] | population_blank1_title = Dialect | population_blank1 = [[Jeolla dialect|Jeolla]] | area_total_km2 = 420.32 | population_as_of = 2001 | population_total = 42229 | population_density_km2 = 100 | parts_type = [[Administrative divisions of South Korea|Administrative divisions]] | parts = 1 ''eup'', 6 ''myeon'' | image_blank_emblem = Jindo logo.jpg | blank_emblem_type = Emblem of Jindo }} '''Jindo County''' (''Jindo-gun'') is a [[Administrative divisions of South Korea|county]] in [[South Jeolla]] Province, [[South Korea]]. It consists of the island of [[Jindo Island|Jindo]] and several smaller nearby islands. Jindo Bridge connects Jindo county with [[Haenam|Haenam county]]. Together with Jindo Island, Jindo County contains an archipelago of about 230 small islands, of which only 45 are inhabited by 4,855 people. Women make up 52% of the total county population of 41,184. Most of the land is covered by forests (60%) and cultivated fields (30%).<ref name=stats>[http://eng.jindo.go.kr/sub.php?pid=EN01020300 Present situation], Jindo County</ref><ref>[http://eng.jindo.go.kr/sub.php?pid=EN01010100 Gretings from Mayor], Jindo County</ref> The county tree is ''[[Persea|Malchilus thunbergii]]'', the flower [[camellia]] and the bird the swan.<ref>[http://eng.jindo.go.kr/sub.php?pid=EN01020200 Symbols], Jindo County</ref> The local food specialties are [[wolfberry]], which is used for liquor, tea and paste; [[Cheongju (wine)|cheongju]] red-colored rice wine, [[Wakame|brown seaweed]] and [[black rice]].<ref>[http://eng.jindo.go.kr/sub.php?pid=EN06010000 Chinese Matrimony Vines(Gugija)], Jindo County</ref> == References == <references/> ==External links== *[http://eng.jindo.go.kr/ County government home page] {{South Jeolla}} {{coord|34.4830555656|N|126.261944454|E|source:ruwiki_region:KR_type:city(42229)|format=dms|display=title}} {{commonscat|Jindo, Jeollanam-do}} [[Category:Counties of South Jeolla Province]] [[Category:Jindo County| ]] {{SouthKorea-geo-stub}}
